meanings.definition: A sharp, sudden sound or movement.
meanings.sent1: The jark of the door slamming shut startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a jark as the branch broke under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent3: The jark of the alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The jark of lightning split the sky in two.
meanings.sent5: The jark of the car crash echoed through the night.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating noise.
meanings.sent1: The old hinges jark when you open the door.
meanings.sent2: The gears in the machine jark loudly when they need oiling.
meanings.sent3: The rusty swing set would always jark when you pushed it.
meanings.sent4: The chains on the bike would jark as he pedaled uphill.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the shutters jark against the window frame.

meanings.sent1: Her jark about his cooking skills stung more than she realized.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help but respond to her jark with a witty comeback.
meanings.sent3: The jark she made about his fashion sense had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His jark cut through the tension in the room like a knife.
meanings.sent5: She delivered her jark with a sly smile, knowing it would hit home.
